author: Staff Reporter
text:
People who had bought houses/flats from the Tamil Nadu Housing Board demanded early disbursement of sale deeds Gathering at the Board office in Sivananda Colony on Monday, the residents said that they placed two demands before the Board officials – accept the demand draft from those buyers who had paid less than the house cost and provide the sale deeds and return the excess paid by others and furnish the sale deeds.

As per a Supreme Court order, the residents had fixed the cost of houses in the six housing units in Coimbatore and had been urging the Board to act on it. Those residents who had paid less than the house cost were at the Board office with demand drafts to pay the dues on Monday.

Their demand was that the Board should accept the money and take steps to release the sale deeds.

Likewise for those residents who had paid in excess of the cost, the Board should return the money with nine per cent interest. State general secretary of the association of buyers, K. Jayachandran, said that the Board officials had promised to act on their grievances and issue sale deeds before March 31.
title: TNHB allottees demand sale deeds
